str2: Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Zeus, the Greek god of the sky in all its manifestations, corresponding to the Roman Jupiter and to the leading god of the native Lycaonians.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
Perhaps from ereo; Hermes, the name of the messenger of the Greek deities; also of a Christian.
Of time: when, now, after that; of cause: seeing that, forasmuch as. From epei and de; since now, i.e. when, or whereas.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
